result.execSummary:
The defendant Lisa Mae McCuen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs/surcharges according to a schedule set up by Probation & Parole.

timeConds.notes: 90 days in the Pepin County Jail with huber privileges with 4 hours per week for child care services.  May serve in Dunn County if traditional jail and at no cost to Pepin County.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lisa Mae McCuen

records.addlTxt: DOC - Notice of Case Status Change Slip - Discharge

This certifies that the following civil rights are restored:
1. The right to vote - See MyVote.wi.gov for information on how to register and vote.
2. The obligation for jury duty.
The following civil rights are not restored to you:
1. Firearms may not be used or possessed unless a pardon, which does not restrict possession of firearms, is
received from the governor.
2. Public office cannot be held unless a pardon is obtained from the governor.
Received verification from DOC defendant paid in full.

Probation review hearing on March 23, 2020 at 09:15 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Lisa Mae McCuen in court with attorney Roger M Hillestad.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel reviewed PSI with his client, no corrections.  No witness by State.  No witnesses by Defense.  Argument by State, disagrees with agent's statement, this does not unduly depreciate the offense severity, protects the community, and considers her lack of correctional experience, prior record and risk to re-offend; recommends 3 yrs., 36 mos. probation, 90 days in PCJ.  Atty Hillestad's closing arguments, 1st offense, she's 29 yrs. old with no prior criminal record, is a single parent w/o any child support; jail not necessary, DOC agrees with counsel; if court adds any sentence to probation, community service be considered.  Court sees red flags all over, 29 yrs old and know what you're doing; other bad acts; selling meth. on 2 occasions and you have a daughter; unstable work history, unstable residential history, less than strong academic background, long history of drug abuse, notes even though this is 1st conviction, it's because you didn't get caught.  Court withholds sentence & places defendant on 3 yrs. probation with condition 90 days in PCJ and find anything less than that would unduly depreciate the seriousness of the offense; addt'l cond:  30 days from now you have no contact with Eric Affolter, no contact with other known drug users; comply with any assessment or counseling set up by P&P; no possession or use of controlled substance w/o a prescription; provide a DNA sample; pay costs of case.  Defense counsel requests defendant be allowed to serve jail in Dunn County.  Court approves if no cost to Pepin Co.; Report July 21 at 6:00 p.m.  If need to change it, call the clerk.  Court authorizes 4 hrs. per week for child care services; advised defendant convicted felon prohibitions; advised of appeal rights.
Letter from DOC re: PSI
Sentencing hearing on June 26, 2017 at 09:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on May 15, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Lisa Mae McCuen in court with attorney Roger M Hillestad.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of charge/max penalties/reviews paragraph 1 of Jury Instructions on conspiracy that was sent to counsel.  Defendant enters plea of guilty.  PLQ/WOR form  filed with the court and reviewed with defendant. Defendant is a citizen of the US and agrees the facts support the charge.  Court finds defendant's waiver of her constitutional rights and plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty.  State agrees to proceed with recommendation without a PSI, defendant has no prior criminal record.  Court doesn't have enough information about her to make a decision, order a PSI.  Any conditions of bond previously set are cont'd.

Defendant Lisa Mae McCuen in court with attorney Roger M. Hillestad.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter remains unresolved.  All parties be here at 8:30 a.m. on trial date of March 14, 2017.
State's Witness List
Notice of State's Expert Witnesses for Jury Trial

Final pre-trial on February 7, 2017 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial on March 14, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Final pre-trial on February 13, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial on March 14, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Jury Trial Scheduling Order:
1.  Trial of this matter is set for jury trial on March 14, 2017 at 9:00 a.m.  Time allowed for trial is one day.
2.  The District Attorney will send the Defense Atty their settlement offer prior to the FPT.
3.  The Defense Atty shall review the DA's settlement offer with his/her client prior to the FPT.
4.  A FPT is set for February 13, 2017 at 9:00 a.m.
5.  The Defense Atty, the Defendant, and the District Atty shall all personally appear at the FPT.
Failure of the Defendant to appear personally at the FPT shall result in the cancellation of the trial date and a warrant being issued for the defendant's arrest.
6.  All motions shall be filed in writing and no later than August 19, 2016. ....
If a motion is filed, the filing attorney shall contact the Court and obtain a pretrial motion hearing date.
Notices of alibi and responses shall follow the time limits and other requirements of Sec. 971.23(8) Wis. Stats.
7.  If either side intends to offer expert testimony..., such party shall give written notice to the court and opposing counsel no later than August 19, 2016, of the name, address and qualifications of the expert, the opinions which will be solicited from such expert and the basis for those opinions. .... 
For complete Order see file.
